VII.i.1.C.4.a
.
When a Notice of Proposed Adverse Action to Remove a Dependent Is Not Required
A notice of proposed adverse action to remove a dependent is
not
required if a beneficiary or a custodian provides VA with the evidence or information that triggers a reduction or discontinuation of benefits.
Reference
:  For more information on the circumstances under which a notice of proposed adverse action
is
required, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 1.B.2.a
.
